overview:
Griffin de Luce is a technologist who has served as CTO for a number of social media properties and startups including:

Active Mind Technologies Inc. AxisVR LLC Green.org Lexus Hybrid Living Solar.com Strike.TV

Griffin left Digital Equipment Corporation in 1994 at a time when the company struggling to capitalize upon it’s Alta Vista Search technology and it’s Alpha 64 bit processor. After a brief period working for JP Morgan’s Global Technology Organization, Griffin founded The Gryphon Group (tgg.com) which was acquired by J. Walter Thompson in the late 90s after successfully becoming the agency of record for Netscape Communications.

Griffin has studied at Computer Science and Japanese at Vassar College and UC Berkeley and is the son of a philosopher and a physicist.

Consulting clients have included:

American Express Apple Inc. Chairman of the SEC Columbia University CEO of Mastercard International Deloite IBM McKinsey & Co. MIT Nortel The New York Times The Wall Street Journal Tibet House

Griffin is passionate about the intersection of technology and the human condition and has applied his efforts bringing about a graceful integration of mobile software, sensors and immersive technologies in an effort to empower people to make smarter decisions for themselves and their planet. Griffin currently serves as Founder of MetaSamurai.com, a technology consultancy which partners with clients through their advertising agency of record or management consultancy.
